ygData.subject: Re: How Network Activation Should Work

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Derek James" <blue5432@y...> wrote:
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@c...>
wrote:
> > It's pretty clear from this discussion that the way Derek and 
> Philip
> > are activating their networks is not the standard way it works in
> > NEAT, because in standard NEAT, you don't need to keep activation 
> in memory from the previous timestep.  
> 
> Perhaps this is just a matter of semantics.  If not, I'm seriously 
> confused.
> 
> The NEAT FAQ question you refer to says:
> 
> "Each node adds up the activation from all incoming nodes from the 
> previous timestep."
> 
> But you just said: "...you don't need to keep activation in memory 
> from the previous timestep."
> 
> How are these two statements compatible?
> 

I see....I had thought from Colin's comment on what you were saying
that you *only* keep activation in memory when there is a recurrent
connection involved, which implies something different.  However, if
it's just that all the previous activations are collected as mentioned
in the FAQ, we are doing things the same way.

Probably it is a good idea to check with Philip to be safe.  It may
turn out to be semantics as you say.

ken

> > It sounds like what Derek and Philip are doing is trying to send
> > activation all the way through the network by traversing the 
> network
> > on each activation.  
> 
> To be honest, I need to check with Philip about exactly how we are 
> handling recurrent activation.  I could be misstating how we have
it 
> working.
> 
> Derek
